By Monotone Convergence Theorem, (a_n) converges to 0 therefore for any \varepsilon > 0, \exist n such that |a_m| \le \varepsilon for all m > n.

I'll proove by induction.

Base case

|S_n - S_n| \le \varepsilon and |S_{n+1} - S_n| \le \varepsilon

Proof

|S_n - S_n| = 0 \le \varepsilon

and

|S_{n+1} - S_n| = |a_{n+1}| \le \varepsilon

Induction step

If

\begin{align} & |S_m - S_n| \le \varepsilon \\ & |S_{m+1} - S_n| \le \varepsilon \end{align}

then

\begin{aligned} &|S_{m+1} - S_n| \le \varepsilon \\ &|S_{m+2} - S_n| \le \varepsilon \end{aligned}

Proof

There are two cases: |S_{m+1} - S_n| ends with either + a_{m+1} or - a_{m+1}.

When |S_{m+1} - S_n| = \pm a_{n+1} \cdots + a_{m+1}

\begin{equation} \begin{split} |S_{m+2} - S_n| &= \pm a_{n+1} \cdots + a_{m+1} - a_{m+2} \\ &= |S_{m+1} - S_n| - a_{m+2} \end{split} \end{equation}

(2) and (3) \implies |S_{m+2} - S_n| \le \varepsilon

When |S_{m+1} - S_n| = \pm a_{n+1} \cdots - a_{m+1}

\begin{equation} \begin{split} |S_{m+2} - S_n| &= \pm a_{n+1} \cdots + a_m - a_{m+1} + a_{m+2} \\ &= |S_m - S_n| - a_{m+1} + a_{m+2} \\ \end{split} \end{equation}

\begin{align} |a_{m}| < |a_{m+1}| \implies - a_{m+1} + a_{m+2} < 0 \end{align}

(1) and (4) and (5) \implies |S_{m+2} - S_n| \le \varepsilon
